DataElement.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin Bed Time Single Perception Psychometrics Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response on a psychometric measure documenting how often a human being feels alone in the world because of CTCL (Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphoma) in the skin. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin Bed Time Single Perception
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being._A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body.  It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else._The process by which the nature and meaning of sensory stimuli are recognized and interpreted.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.

Concepts.definition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.:The process by which the nature and meaning of sensory stimuli are recognized and interpreted.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC curated to support curation of CTCL-Specific items used in questionnaire by CCR for use with Skindex measure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened all of the time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I feel alone in the world bec
ReferenceDocuments.description: I feel alone in the world becaue of my skin condition.
